20101230013151.000|20101230013153.000|CC1|FOR JOINING US.

20101230013155.000|20101230013157.000|CC1|WITH JUST TWO DAYS LEFT IN 2010,
20101230013157.000|20101230013158.000|CC1|ECONOMISTS ARE RETHINKING THEIR 
20101230013158.000|20101230013201.000|CC1|OUTLOOK FOR 2011.

20101230013203.000|20101230013204.000|CC1|BEST DECEMBER PERFORMANCE IN    
20101230013204.000|20101230013205.000|CC1|ALMOST 20 YEARS.

20101230013206.000|20101230013207.000|CC1|THAN HOPED, AND THE ECONOMY IS

20101230013210.000|20101230013213.000|CC1|JOBS.

20101230013217.000|20101230013218.000|CC1|WORKERS NEXT YEAR, BUT NOT UNTIL
20101230013218.000|20101230013219.000|CC1|THEY'RE SURE DEMAND WILL SUPPORT
20101230013219.000|20101230013222.000|CC1|THOSE WORKERS.                  
20101230013222.000|20101230013223.000|CC1|SUZANNE PRATT LOOKS AT WHERE THE
20101230013223.000|20101230013224.000|CC1|ECONOMY COULD BE HEADED NEXT    
20101230013224.000|20101230013224.000|CC1|YEAR.                           
20101230013224.000|20101230013225.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WHEN IT COMES TO   
20101230013225.000|20101230013226.000|CC1|THE U.S. ECONOMY IN 2011,       
20101230013226.000|20101230013228.000|CC1|THERE'S GOOD NEWS AND BAD NEWS. 
20101230013228.000|20101230013231.000|CC1|LET'S START WITH THE GOOD.      
20101230013231.000|20101230013234.000|CC1|IF FORECASTS ARE CORRECT, G.D.P.
20101230013234.000|20101230013235.000|CC1|WILL GROW AT AN ANNUAL RATE NEXT
20101230013235.000|20101230013235.000|CC1|YEAR OF ANYWHERE FROM 3% TO     
20101230013235.000|20101230013239.000|CC1|3.5%.                           
20101230013239.000|20101230013239.000|CC1|IT WOULD BE THE STRONGEST       
20101230013239.000|20101230013240.000|CC1|SHOWING FOR THE U.S. ECONOMY IN 
20101230013240.000|20101230013243.000|CC1|FOUR YEARS.                     
20101230013243.000|20101230013244.000|CC1|IN THE LAST FEW WEEKS, EXPERTS  
20101230013244.000|20101230013245.000|CC1|HAVE BEEN UPPING THEIR GROWTH   
20101230013245.000|20101230013247.000|CC1|TARGETS.                        
20101230013247.000|20101230013248.000|CC1|THAT'S THANKS TO THE IMPROVED   
20101230013248.000|20101230013249.000|CC1|TONE OF ECONOMIC DATA, AS WELL  
20101230013249.000|20101230013249.000|CC1|AS THE EXTENSION OF BUSH-ERA TAX
20101230013249.000|20101230013253.000|CC1|CUTS.                           
20101230013253.000|20101230013255.000|CC1|STILL, P.N.C.'S STUART HOFFMAN  
20101230013255.000|20101230013256.000|CC1|SAYS THE U.S. ECONOMY SHOULD BE 
20101230013256.000|20101230013258.000|CC1|STRONGER.                       
20101230013258.000|20101230013300.000|CC1|>> IF ANYTHING I CALL IT A HALF-
20101230013300.000|20101230013302.000|CC1|SPEED ECONOMIC RECOVERY IN THE  
20101230013302.000|20101230013303.000|CC1|SENSE THAT THE GAINS, NOT ONLY  
20101230013303.000|20101230013304.000|CC1|THIS YEAR, BUT PROBABLY AGAIN   
20101230013304.000|20101230013307.000|CC1|NEXT YEAR, AREN'T THE TYPICAL

20101230013309.000|20101230013311.000|CC1|WOULD EXPECT AFTER SUCH A DEEP

20101230013317.000|20101230013318.000|CC1|>> Reporter: NOW, FOR THE BAD   
20101230013318.000|20101230013319.000|CC1|NEWS.                           
20101230013319.000|20101230013319.000|CC1|IF YOU GUESSED IT WILL BE THE   
20101230013319.000|20101230013320.000|CC1|SORRY STATE OF THE LABOR MARKET,
20101230013320.000|20101230013322.000|CC1|YOU'RE CORRECT.

20101230013323.000|20101230013324.000|CC1|UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IN 2011 WILL

20101230013332.000|20101230013333.000|CC1|THAT WE CAN HAVE AN EXPANDING

20101230013336.000|20101230013338.000|CC1|>> THE LABOR MARKET'S GOING TO

20101230013343.000|20101230013344.000|CC1|JOBS, BUT RATHER THE            
20101230013344.000|20101230013344.000|CC1|UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IS GOING TO   
20101230013344.000|20101230013346.000|CC1|STAY HIGH.

20101230013353.000|20101230013356.000|CC1|WOULD BE.

20101230013413.000|20101230013417.000|CC1|AS $1.5 TRILLION IN 2011.

20101230013444.000|20101230013445.000|CC1|BY HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT, WHICH WILL

20101230013445.000|20101230013446.000|CC1|SUZANNE PRATT, "NIGHTLY BUSINESS
20101230013446.000|20101230013452.000|CC1|REPORT," NEW YORK.

20101230013606.000|20101230013607.000|CC1|STRANDED BY THIS PAST WEEKEND'S 
20101230013607.000|20101230013607.000|CC1|GIANT SNOWSTORM IN THE          
20101230013607.000|20101230013610.000|CC1|NORTHEAST.

20101230013612.000|20101230013613.000|CC1|AREA AIRPORTS ON TIME, RAIL     
20101230013613.000|20101230013614.000|CC1|TRAVEL IS IMPROVING AND MAJOR   
20101230013614.000|20101230013619.000|CC1|ROADWAYS ARE CLEAR OF SNOW.     
20101230013619.000|20101230013620.000|CC1|MEANWHILE, THE BLIZZARD KEPT    
20101230013620.000|20101230013621.000|CC1|SHOPPERS FROM SPENDING $1       
20101230013621.000|20101230013623.000|CC1|BILLION SUNDAY AND MONDAY.      
20101230013623.000|20101230013624.000|CC1|BUT RETAILERS ARE HOPEFUL THOSE 
20101230013624.000|20101230013625.000|CC1|SALES WILL BOUNCE BACK AS       
20101230013625.000|20101230013626.000|CC1|STREETS ARE CLEARED AND         
20101230013626.000|20101230013626.000|CC1|TRANSPORTATION GETS BACK TO     
20101230013626.000|20101230013629.000|CC1|NORMAL.                         
20101230013629.000|20101230013630.000|CC1|SHOPPER TRACK, WHICH TALLIES THE
20101230013630.000|20101230013630.000|CC1|NUMBERS, SAYS THE TWO DAYS AFTER
20101230013630.000|20101230013631.000|CC1|CHRISTMAS USUALLY GENERATE ABOUT
20101230013631.000|20101230013638.000|CC1|$10 BILLION OF SALES.           
20101230013638.000|20101230013639.000|CC1|THE WINTER BLAST ALSO BROUGHT   
20101230013639.000|20101230013640.000|CC1|HISTORIC COLD TEMPERATURES TO   
20101230013640.000|20101230013641.000|CC1|FLORIDA FARMERS.                
20101230013641.000|20101230013642.000|CC1|THOUSANDS OF ACRES OF CUCUMBERS,
20101230013642.000|20101230013642.000|CC1|SQUASH AND OTHER WINTER         
20101230013642.000|20101230013644.000|CC1|VEGETABLES FROZE, COSTING       
20101230013644.000|20101230013645.000|CC1|FLORIDA'S AGRICULTURE INDUSTRY  
20101230013645.000|20101230013648.000|CC1|AN ESTIMATED $115 MILLION.      
20101230013648.000|20101230013649.000|CC1|THAT KIND OF ECONOMIC DAMAGE IS 
20101230013649.000|20101230013650.000|CC1|ON PAR WITH THE EXPECTED LOSSES 
20101230013650.000|20101230013655.000|CC1|IN THE AIRLINE INDUSTRY.        
20101230013655.000|20101230013656.000|CC1|SAM ACCURSIO FARMS 2,000 ACRES  
20101230013656.000|20101230013657.000|CC1|SOUTH OF HOMESTEAD, FLORIDA--   
20101230013657.000|20101230013659.000|CC1|ESSENTIALLY AT THE SOUTHERN TIP 
20101230013659.000|20101230013700.000|CC1|OF THE U.S. MAINLAND.           
20101230013700.000|20101230013702.000|CC1|WE VISITED HIM IN HIS FIELDS--  
20101230013702.000|20101230013705.000|CC1|ONE THAT SURVIVED THE COLD, AND 
20101230013705.000|20101230013709.000|CC1|ANOTHER THAT DIDN'T.            
20101230013709.000|20101230013710.000|CC1|>> PLAN CAN ONLY TAKE SO MUCH OF
20101230013710.000|20101230013711.000|CC1|THIS.

20101230013713.000|20101230013714.000|CC1|THIS IS THE THIRD FROST THESE

20101230013719.000|20101230013719.000|CC1|HARVEST.

20101230013721.000|20101230013724.000|CC1|HAVE INVESTED IN THIS 10 ACRES  
20101230013724.000|20101230013726.000|CC1|THAT WE'RE LOOKING AT?          
20101230013726.000|20101230013728.000|CC1|>> IT APPROXIMATELY $2,000 PER  
20101230013728.000|20101230013729.000|CC1|ACRE.

20101230013735.000|20101230013736.000|CC1|WHAT DO YOU EXPECT TO GET BACK  
20101230013736.000|20101230013739.000|CC1|IN REVENUE WHEN YOU HARVEST     
20101230013739.000|20101230013739.000|CC1|THESE?                          
20101230013739.000|20101230013742.000|CC1|>> WE NEVER KNOW, BECAUSE WE'RE,
20101230013742.000|20101230013744.000|CC1|IT'S SUPPLY AND DEMAND.         
20101230013744.000|20101230013745.000|CC1|WE DON'T MAKE THE PRICE.        
20101230013745.000|20101230013746.000|CC1|WE TAKE THE PRICE, WHATEVER THEY
20101230013746.000|20101230013747.000|CC1|GIVE US.                        
20101230013747.000|20101230013748.000|CC1|BUT WE THINK IT WILL BE, YOU    
20101230013748.000|20101230013751.000|CC1|KNOW, HOPEFULLY $4,000 AN ACRE. 
20101230013751.000|20101230013752.000|CC1|>> Reporter: LET'S TAKE A LOOK  
20101230013752.000|20101230013754.000|CC1|AT SOME OF THE DAMAGE IN THE    
20101230013754.000|20101230013754.000|CC1|HEALTHY PLANTS HERE.            
20101230013754.000|20101230013755.000|CC1|>> YOU CAN SEE HOW MUCH THE     
20101230013755.000|20101230013757.000|CC1|SQUASH HAS GROWN SINCE THIS     
20101230013757.000|20101230013758.000|CC1|FIRST FROST, BECAUSE ALL THIS   
20101230013758.000|20101230013800.000|CC1|GREEN IS THE NEW GROWTH.        
20101230013800.000|20101230013802.000|CC1|BUT THE OTHER NIGHT, LIKE I TOLD
20101230013802.000|20101230013804.000|CC1|YOU, YOU COULD ONLY OUT HERE AND
20101230013804.000|20101230013805.000|CC1|TAKE THIS AND IT WAS JUST LIKE  
20101230013805.000|20101230013807.000|CC1|AN ICE CUBE WHEN YOU PICKED A   
20101230013807.000|20101230013809.000|CC1|LEAF OFF, SOLID FROZEN.         
20101230013809.000|20101230013810.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SO THIS ONE HERE   
20101230013810.000|20101230013812.000|CC1|WITH THIS DAMAGED LEAF, YOU DO  
20101230013812.000|20101230013814.000|CC1|SEE A NICE, THIS ONE LOOKS LIKE 
20101230013814.000|20101230013814.000|CC1|--                              
20101230013814.000|20101230013815.000|CC1|>> YES.                         
20101230013815.000|20101230013817.000|CC1|WE'RE GOING TO HARVEST THAT.

20101230015452.000|20101230015454.000|CC1|HAPPENS.                        
20101230015454.000|20101230015454.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THAT'S WHEN        
20101230015454.000|20101230015455.000|CC1|McCAULEY REALIZED SHE'D HAVE TO 
20101230015455.000|20101230015456.000|CC1|COME UP WITH THE MONEY A        
20101230015456.000|20101230015457.000|CC1|DIFFERENT WAY.                  
20101230015457.000|20101230015458.000|CC1|SHE USED CASH RESERVES TO DOUBLE
20101230015458.000|20101230015500.000|CC1|THE NUMBER OF PROGRAMS SHE WAS  
20101230015500.000|20101230015501.000|CC1|OFFERING, AND TO GET THE WORD   
20101230015501.000|20101230015501.000|CC1|OUT.                            
20101230015501.000|20101230015502.000|CC1|>> BY HAVING MORE THINGS TO     
20101230015502.000|20101230015503.000|CC1|OFFER, WE GOT MORE INTEREST FROM
20101230015503.000|20101230015504.000|CC1|INDIVIDUALS AND CORPORATE       
20101230015504.000|20101230015507.000|CC1|DONORS.                         
20101230015507.000|20101230015507.000|CC1|SO THAT'S KIND OF HOW WE STAYED 
20101230015507.000|20101230015509.000|CC1|AFLOAT.                         
20101230015509.000|20101230015509.000|CC1|>> Reporter: EVEN IF GOVERNMENT 
20101230015509.000|20101230015510.000|CC1|MONEY DRIES UP COMPLETELY,      
20101230015510.000|20101230015512.000|CC1|McCAULEY SAYS SHE'LL JUST WORK  
20101230015512.000|20101230015514.000|CC1|HARDER.                         
20101230015514.000|20101230015516.000|CC1|>> WE'RE GOING TO HAVE TO KEEP  
20101230015516.000|20101230015518.000|CC1|REACHING OUT TO NEW DONORS AND  
20101230015518.000|20101230015520.000|CC1|KEEP GETTING THE WORD OUT ABOUT 
20101230015520.000|20101230015522.000|CC1|WHAT WE DO, BECAUSE IT SEEMS THE
20101230015522.000|20101230015524.000|CC1|MORE PEOPLE KNOW ABOUT US, THE  
20101230015524.000|20101230015525.000|CC1|MORE PEOPLE WANT TO HELP US AND 
20101230015525.000|20101230015526.000|CC1|KEEP US GOING.                  
20101230015526.000|20101230015528.000|CC1|>> Reporter: TOMORROW WE'LL LOOK
20101230015528.000|20101230015528.000|CC1|AT HOW NON-PROFITS IN THE ARTS  
20101230015528.000|20101230015530.000|CC1|ARE FARING, AS DONATIONS TO MANY
20101230015530.000|20101230015531.000|CC1|OF THEM HAVE FALLEN.            
20101230015531.000|20101230015532.000|CC1|ANNA OLSON, "NIGHTLY BUSINESS   
20101230015532.000|20101230015540.000|CC1|REPORT," WASHINGTON.
